pull.title: Coinbaser
pull.body: GitHub fail. It screwed up the pull req while merging updates from master... sigh

events.message: Execute command specified by -coinbaser when creating a new block, which can output data to control where the generation goes
coinbaser: replace %d in command line with available funds
Replace nBits in coinbase scriptSig with arbitrary data set by setworkaux RPC call
Bugfix/safeguard: never create a coinbase scriptSig over 100 bytes long
Check for parse or overflow errors in setworkaux

Merge commit '96f9693' into coinbaser

Conflicts:
	src/main.cpp
	src/main.h
	src/rpc.cpp

Merge branch 'coinbaser'

Conflicts:
	src/bitcoinrpc.cpp
	src/main.cpp

Hand-merging:
	src/bitcoinrpc.cpp
	src/main.cpp
	src/main.h

events.body:
Closing, but we can re-open if there is sufficient buy-in from other mining operations.

If accepted, would lean towards _only_ using TCP, as external program execution is more complicated and less portable (Windows does not have an exec, strictly speaking, so spawning details differ).
Um, wtf? This was already accepted for 0.6
